name: Under Armour Women's Heatgear Bike Shorts

title: Good to Go
content: I purchased these to wear under jogging shorts, to stop chafing on my inner thighs and to help stop any jiggling while jogging.  Does the job well, holding everything in place for my 5 mile fun runs. Well worth the money.  Quality material, snug yet comfortable.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: These are wonderful on my plus size body. I used them in my triathlon and they never rolled up nor fell down. They were perfect!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2024

title: Perfect material
content: Exactly what I was looking for to walk in. I had a couple of older Under Armor compression shorts but needed a couple more so I don't have to do laundry every two days. These have a much wider waistband and the compression is really good. Fantastic for the price.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I love the material!! The waist band isn‚Äôt as stretchy as most biker shorts or athletic leggings that I‚Äôm used to, so they are pretty tight. Still comfortable and worked great for the gym with light sliding down or rolling up on the legs.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2023

title: Well made and good compression.
content: Cute color - makes you very well seen on the trails/roads (bright orange!) great true to size fit. Feel great and wonderful quality üß°
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: These shorts were exactly what I was looking for, and they fit great. The only thing that surprised me was that the color of the shorts was much lighter in person, but I love the color anyways.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2024

title: A good purchase!
content: The color is lovely. These run true to size. They are very soft, stretchy, and supportive. They've held up very well to regular workouts.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: These shorts were kind of see through and not near as stretchy as other bike shorts I have from Old Navy. For the price I wouldn't buy again, but the color was very fun and shiny. Also no pockets.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2024

title: Great fit! Exactly as described
content: Fits just right to size
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I normally wear size small and that's what I ordered. The legs are loose on my thighs but not saggy. I have a lean build. The material just sits on my thighs so to speak. I find this unusual for activewear.  The waist is super high waisted. Would have been perfect if there was compression in the waist and legs. Maybe I could try the extra small next time.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023

title: What Can I Say, They‚Äôre Workout Shorts
content: Very comfortable for any activity you may find yourself in. On me, the legs come mid-thigh or slightly higher but do not ‚Äúride up‚Äù.  I own a million pair of these in black so decided to try the navy? dark blue? I like the color very much

title: Verified Purchase
content: Size 18 is a XXL and way off from other clothes I own from the brand. I'm a perfect Xl 16/18 and should have got the 16 for a compression fit. For the price and quality I'll just use them around the house but not for running.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023

title: Size down if you like tighter

title: Verified Purchase
content: Unflattering, uncomfortable, and not as described.  They're supposed to be compression.  They aren't.  They were pinching really badly at the waistband, even though it hit at the smallest part of my waist, but were too big everywhere else.  Really weirdly cut, terrible fit, and the fabric felt cheap.  On the plus side, they did seem to be full coverage.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023

title: Comfortable
content: I bought these as running shorts, looking for something a little longer to prevent thigh chafing. This totally did the job. I was a little hesitant that they might show sweat but I haven't experience a problem with that either.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020

title: Verified Purchase
content: I have never worn Under Armour gym clothes before, but I got these to see if they were comparable to Nike shorts I have.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2024

title: No compression, except for tight uncomfortable waistband
content: The fabric is thick enough to be opaque, but still lightweight. It's very similar to a ponte knit fabric. I ordered these shorts in black and I've never felt overheated from the fabric, so I suppose the heat gear works.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: If you order true to size, these are not compression. They fit, but I don't feel that hug that I like from gym pants and leggings. You can wear them a couple times without them stretching out, but even fresh out of the dryer they don't fit snug anywhere.

title: Good quality

title: Verified Purchase
content: I own a lot of HeatGear bottoms and love them all for the lightweight silky fabric and the great compression. These shorts are very nice, but they are much larger than any other Mediums that I own and they just don't have much stretch or compression. I have large thighs and the hems on these are very loose. I was really disappointed because I have been looking for the 8" length for several years, but I still have a pair of 7" shorts that are in great shape even after several years of wear.

title: Verified Purchase
content: Though the item is labeled as heat gear the band is not the same as the heat gear capris or leggings. Has an extensive amount of compression and if compared to the other heat gear brand items these shorts run small. So order up a size or two unless you don't like the feeling of being able to breathe when sitting, squatting, ect.

title: Not like Under Armour other heat gear bands
content: The 2X fit great through my waist, but too big everywhere else. The 1X fit great everywhere but the waist. The problem seems to be the tight elastic around the top of the waist band. There is no stretch at all. Maybe after wearing and washing a few times it‚Äôll loosen, but who knows. These were purchased for theme park days. For the price and heatgear material, I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll do the job. In case it‚Äôs helpful to others, I‚Äôm an hourglass, normally a size 16-18, and I‚Äôm post 2 csections.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: These shorts are the best! Long enough to prevent chafing, and compressioned enough that I'm able to run faster. I dont miss the pockets since I'm usually wearing a hydration vest or belt.
